title: RME-Based Instructional Research Workshop for High School Mathematics Teachers' Professional Development

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of high school mathematics curriculum and basic teaching methodologies, basic awareness of Realistic Mathematics Education (RME) concepts
context.additional_context: Participants collaborate in real-time via Zoom within smartphone-based limited technology environments, submitting final outputs through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Develop a lesson module that solves real-life contextual math problems by applying the Realistic Mathematics Education (RME) principle-based instructional design process.
Conduct collaborative lesson improvement activities with peer teachers using the Learning Study in Lesson Communities (LSLC) operational model.
Measure the effectiveness of RME lessons using a multi-layered assessment tool combining formative and summative evaluations.

resources: LSLC (Learning Support Learning Community) Operation Template
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
